result.execSummary:
The defendant Ariel Charles Waddell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ariel Charles Waddell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ariel Charles Waddell was found guilty of Possession of THC (Tetrahydrocannabinols), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ariel Charles Waddell was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid court costs converted to a civil judgment.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to receive an AODA evaluation and follow through with any treatment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed within the 1st year of probation.
